New Records: Sunil Chhetri became the 8th player in the world and the first Indian footballer to play 150 or more international matches.
Key Match Events: India lost to Afghanistan 2-1 in the FIFA World Cup 2026 Qualifier
Sunil Chhetri scored the only goal for India, his 94th international goal.
Post-Match Reflections: India's defeat against Afghanistan has diminished its chances of qualifying for a place in the third round of the FIFA World Cup 2026 and AFC Asian Cup 2027 Preliminary Joint Qualifiers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India has just four points from four matches in the four-team Round 2 group
Qatar leads the group with nine points from three matches, while Afghanistan has four points from three matches.
Others: Sunil Chhetri has been named AIFF Male Player of the Year seven times.
Amongst the active players, Sunil Chhetri is the third-highest goal scorer in international matches.
Sunil Chhetri played his first international match for India in 2005 and scored his first goal for the senior India national football team against Pakistan.
